byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from Damascus, Syria.
byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and NOUR YOUSSEF

abstract: Major Mohamed Reda, chief detective at Izbakiya police station in Egypt, files criminal complaint against Reuters for allegedly spreading false news and harming country's image; complaint stems from April article linking Reda's police station to January disappearance of Italian student Giulio Regeni; human rights workers say Regeni's burned and beaten remains, discovered outside of Cairo, suggested police interrogation.
lead_paragraph: The news agency reported that Giulio Regeni, an Italian graduate student, was in police custody before his death, a claim that law enforcement officials have denied.

headline.main: Egyptian Police Official Files Complaint Against Reuters
headline.print_headline: Criminal Complaint Filed Against Reuters in Egypt Over Report on Student’s Death

snippet: The news agency reported that Giulio Regeni, an Italian graduate student, was in police custody before his death, a claim that law enforcement officials have denied.
